Uses of Class
org.cojen.tupl.DatabaseException

  • Packages that use DatabaseException 
    Package Description
    org.cojen.tupl
    See Database to get started with Tupl.

    • Uses of DatabaseException in org.cojen.tupl

      Subclasses of DatabaseException in org.cojen.tupl 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  CacheExhaustedException
      Thrown when the database cache is full and no more data can be loaded into it.
      class  ClosedIndexException
      Thrown when attempting to modify the contents of an index through a closed reference.
      class  ConfirmationFailureException
      Thrown by ReplicationManager when replication cannot be confirmed.
      class  ConfirmationInterruptedException
      Thrown by ReplicationManager when confirmation was interrupted by another thread.
      class  ConfirmationTimeoutException
      Thrown by ReplicationManager when replication confirmation timed out.
      class  CorruptDatabaseException
      Thrown when the internal structure of the database is corrupt.
      class  DatabaseFullException
      Thrown when database is full and no more data can be stored into it.
      class  DeadlockException
      Thrown when a lock request by a transaction timed out due to a deadlock.
      class  IllegalUpgradeException
      Thrown when attempting to acquire an upgradable or exclusive lock when a shared lock is already held.
      class  IncompleteRestoreException
      Thrown when opening a database which wasn't completely restored.
      class  InvalidTransactionException
      Thrown when acting upon a broken transaction instance.
      class  LargeKeyException
      Thrown when attempting to load a key which cannot fit into memory.
      class  LargeValueException
      Thrown when attempting to load a value which cannot fit into memory.
      class  LockFailureException
      Thrown when a lock request by a transaction failed.
      class  LockInterruptedException
      Thrown when a lock request by a transaction was interrupted by another thread.
      class  LockTimeoutException
      Thrown when a lock request by a transaction timed out.
      class  NoSuchValueException
      Thrown when reading from an accessor stream, for a value which doesn't exist.
      class  UnmodifiableReplicaException
      Thrown when attempting to make changes to a read-only replica.
      class  UnmodifiableViewException
      Thrown when attempting to make a change to an index or view which doesn't permit modifications.
      class  ViewConstraintException
      Thrown when attempting to perform an illegal view alteration.
      class  WriteFailureException
      Thrown when writing to the underlying storage device failed.
      Methods in org.cojen.tupl that throw DatabaseException 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void Transaction.check​()
      Checks the validity of the transaction.
